newsitem.title: USA: Calif. measure would bar closed-door budget talks.
newsitem.headline: Calif. measure would bar closed-door budget talks.

text.p: A California state assemblyman introduced a resolution Monday to bar back-room budget negotiations by the governor and legislative leaders.
Assemblyman Don Perata, a freshman Democrat, presented the resolution to the Assembly rules committee, which referred it to the budget committee. A hearing date has yet to be set.
The resolution would bar closed-door meetings of the so-called "Big Five," a group that includes senior legislative leaders and Gov. Pete Wilson.
The Big Five typically meets in private to negotiate a budget compromise. The budget that emerges is then brought to floors of the Senate and Assembly for enactment.
Critics charge that the Big Five usurps the authority of the Senate and Assembly to make budget decisions.
